abstract: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency finds numerous violations by Bank of America related accounts of 73,000 military service members that will result in $30 million fine.
lead_paragraph: The bank said it would pay $30 million and improve its monitoring and compliance practices in regard to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.

headline.main: Bank of America Fined for Violations of Military Relief Law
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Bank Is Fined Over Military Account Violations

snippet: The bank said it would pay $30 million and improve its monitoring and compliance practices in regard to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.
